qas.question: What group of Jews represent the bulk of modern Jewry?
Which group represents at least 70% of Jews worldwide?
Why does Ashkenazim represent the overwhelming majority of Jews in the New World continents?

answers.text: As a result of their emigration from Europe

qas.question: In what country does the immigration of Jews from Algeria (Sephardim) has led them to outnumber the Ashkenazim?
Who represents the minority of modern Jewry?
Which group represents less than 70% of Jews worldwide?
What is a country where Ashkenazi Jews have not emigrated to?

plausible_answers.text: As a result of their emigration from Europe

qas.question: Why do Sephardim represent the overwhelming majority of Jews in the New World?
Where is the Jewish population least representative of all groups?

context: <a0_0><a1_0><b4_0><b5_0>Ashkenazi Jews<b5_0/><b4_0/><a1_0/><a0_0/> represent the bulk of modern Jewry, with at least 70% of Jews worldwide (and up to 90% prior to World War II and the Holocaust). <a2_0><b7_0>As a result of their emigration from Europe<b7_0/><a2_0/>, Ashkenazim also represent the overwhelming majority of Jews in the New World continents, in countries such as the <b6_0>United States<b6_0/>, Canada, Argentina, Australia, and Brazil. In <a3_0>France<a3_0/>, the immigration of Jews from Algeria (Sephardim) has led them to outnumber the Ashkenazim. Only in <b8_0>Israel<b8_0/> is the Jewish population representative of all groups, a melting pot independent of each group's proportion within the overall world Jewish population.
